question_content.barrons:question: Which question did Lind’s experiment NOT answer?

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: Will either sulfuric acid or vinegar cure scurvy?
Are lemons more effective than either sulfuric acid or vinegar in the treatment of scurvy?
Are all substances that contain acids equally effective as treatments for scurvy?

question_content.barrons:explanation:
Will pure citric acid cure scurvy?

Lind’s experiment did not answer the question Will pure citric acid cure scurvy? Lind did not use pure citric acid. He used lemon juice, which contains other substances besides citric acid.

Will lemons cure scurvy is incorrect. Lind’s experiment answered the question Will lemons cure scurvy? The sailors who ate the lemons recovered.

Will either sulfuric acid or vinegar cure scurvy is incorrect. Lind’s experiment answered the question Will either sulfur acid or vinegar cure scurvy? The sailors who were given either sulfur acid or vinegar failed to recover.

Are lemons more effective than either sulfuric acid or vinegar in the treatment of scurvy is incorrect. Lind’s experiment answered the question Are lemons more effective than either sulfuric acid or vinegar in the treatment of scurvy? The lemons were more effective than both the sulfuric acid and the vinegar.

Are all substances that contain acids equally effective as treatments for scurvy is incorrect. Lind’s experiment answered the question Are all substances that contain acids equally effective as treatments for scurvy? All the substances that contained acids were not equally effective as treatments for scurvy.
